album.title: How to Dismantle an Atomic Bomb

wiki.content:
'Sometimes you can't make it on your own' was written by lead singer Bono as a tribute to his father, Bob Hewson, who died in 2001; Bono sang this at his funeral. The video to the song begins with a note from Bono about his father, saying "I wish I'd known him better."
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: 'Sometimes you can't make it on your own' was written by lead singer Bono as a tribute to his father, Bob Hewson, who died in 2001; Bono sang this at his funeral. The video to the song begins with a note from Bono about his father, saying "I wish I'd known him better."

track.name: Sometimes You Can't Make It On Your Own
comments: makes me cry every time i hear this

Damn, what a great song. This song exemplifies all that is great about U2. I'm sure they could very easily write cheasy pop songs about horse shit topics like most of the other garbage bands out there, but I remember Bono once said that a true artist choses to "Reveal rather than conceal" and that's what makes them great. He is right, obviously this song is incredibly personal and these lyrics are absolutely heartfelt by Bono. I haven't spoken to my father in years, and this song just always tears me up..... I appreciate the fact that there are bands out there like U2, who continue to be original and choose to lead instead of follow.
Great song! Bono is truely a saint.
This song always brings me to tears, reminding me of the father that I haven't spoken to in 5 years.
Truly a masterpiece ! best part is the bridge so beautiful!
makes me remember and think of my mother
Listen to U2 on my radio station!
the soul of the song. if i were bono's dad, i'd forgive him.
its you its you on your own.more then singing a song.on your own

*`We fight all the time
You and I...that's alright
We're the same soul
I don't need...I don't need to hear you say
That if we weren't so alike
You'd like me a whole lot more...* ♥   =]
This song is so good it makes you feel inadequate as a person.

Heartbreaking song...for those who don't know, Bono wrote this after his father, who he was estranged with, passed away.  Mark of a great artist when they can put their pain into words and record a song they can share with people!
